summary: James P. Kelly was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents list his name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents do not specify his role within the committee, but his presence on the payroll indicates he was a staff member during the SCAS investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: James P. Kelly's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll suggests he contributed to the committee's work.
